newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: RAND WEAKENS ON LONRHO SUGAR BUY - DEALERS.
newsitem.headline: RAND WEAKENS ON LONRHO SUGAR BUY - DEALERS.

text.p: The rand's slide to its weakest levels in two months on Thursday was prompted by South African firm Illovo Sugar Ltd's purchase of Lonrho Sugar Corp from U.K-based Lonrho Plc for over 1.6 billion rand, foreign exchange dealers said.
"The weakness is on the London sterling/rand buy," a dealer said.
"It is a large sterling/rand order in the region of 200 million sterling and it is part of the Illovo buy," he said.

Local market leader Illovo Sugar Ltd said on Thursday it had agreed to buy Lonrho Plc's entire 94.25 percent shareholding in Lonrho Sugar Corp Ltd for 13.90 rand per share in cash, or 1,623.7 million rand.
Dealers said a large portion of the deal had already passed through the currency market earlier in the morning.

"There is still a bit to be done, but I see (the rand) capped at around 4.4850 bid to the dollar. Once it's all finished the rand should come off, if not today, then tomorrow (Friday)," a dealer said.

At 0810 GMT the rand was trading at 4.4750/4780 against the dollar from 4.4535/4565 late on Wednesday. It touched a morning worst of 4.4785 bid -- its weakest level since February 28 when it touched 4.4835 bid.
The Illovo acquisition, which ends months of speculation about the future of Lonrho's sugar business, will create Africa's biggest sugar group with interests ranging across Southern and East Africa.
